Constructor

Parameters

X Matrix of inputs (locations) Y Vector outputs (observations) nActivePoints Maximum number of active points _iterChancing Number of sweeps through the data with replacement of active points (default: 1) _iterFixed Number of sweeps through the data with fixed active set (default :2)

void PSGP::makePredictions ( vec &  Mean,
vec &  Variance,
const mat &  Xpred,
CovarianceFunction &  cf 
) const

Make predictions at a set of locations Xpred. The mean and variance are returned in the Mean and Variance vectors. To use a different covariance function to the training one (useful to do non noisy predictions), you can pass an optional CovarianceFunction object.

Make predictions

Definition at line 1183 of file PSGP.cpp.

References likelihoodType.

void PSGP::processObservationEP ( const int  iObs,
const LikelihoodType &  noiseModel,
const bool  fixActiveSet 
) [private]

This is the core method, implementing the sparse EP algorithm

This algorithm follows Appendix G in in Lehel Csato's PhD thesis "Gaussian Processes - Iterative Sparse Approximations", 2002, NCRG, Aston University.

Further reference numbers correspond to sections/equations in the same document.

Delete an active point from the active set

: iObs The index of the active point to be deleted

Definition at line 491 of file PSGP.cpp.

References ActiveSet, alpha, C, idxActiveSet, KB, P, Q, and sizeActiveSet.

Referenced by EP_removeCollapsedPoints(), and processObservationEP().

void PSGP::addActivePointAugmented_v1 ( int  iObs,
double  q,
double  r,
vec  k,
double  sigmaLoc,
double  gamma,
vec  eHat 
) [private]

Swap current observation with an existing active point if this results in an improved active set.

What we do is build an extended active set (of size maxActiveSet+1) and then remove the active point with the lowest score to get back to size maxActiveSet. Instead of adding/removing, we use temporary augmented matrices and only update the original matrices if a swap is necessary. This avoids expensive memory operations.

Definition at line 373 of file PSGP.cpp.

References ActiveSet, ActiveSet_aug, alpha, alpha_aug, C, C_aug, FullKL, idxActiveSet, idxActiveSet_aug, KB, KB_aug, Locations, maxActiveSet, nObs, P, P_aug, Q, Q_aug, scoreActivePoints(), sizeActiveSet, and swapActivePoint_v1().

Referenced by processObservationEP().

void PSGP::swapActivePoint_v1 ( int  iDel  )  [private]

Swap specified active point (iObs) with new active point (last index in augmented matrices)

Definition at line 535 of file PSGP.cpp.

References ActiveSet, ActiveSet_aug, alpha, alpha_aug, C, C_aug, idxActiveSet, idxActiveSet_aug, KB, KB_aug, maxActiveSet, P, P_aug, Q, and Q_aug.

Referenced by addActivePointAugmented_v1().

void PSGP::addActivePointAugmented_v2 ( int  iObs,
double  q,
double  r,
vec  k,
double  sigmaLoc,
double  gamma,
vec  eHat 
) [private]

Swap current observation with an existing active point if this results in an improved active set.

Typically, we:

  • add a new observation to the active set (but store its effect separately)
  • remove one observation from the new, extended active set (to get back to the maximum size allowe)
  • update the C and alpha to reflect the addition/removal of an observation. However, we do it in such a way that there is minimal use of memory and no resizing of C and alpha.

Definition at line 444 of file PSGP.cpp.

References ActiveSet_new, alpha, alpha_new, C, c_new, C_new, FullKL, idxActiveSet_new, kb_new, KB_new, Locations, maxActiveSet, nObs, P_new, Q, q_new, Q_new, scoreActivePoints(), sizeActiveSet, and swapActivePoint_v2().

Referenced by processObservationEP().

void PSGP::swapActivePoint_v2 ( int  iDel  )  [private]

Replaces given active point (iDel) with new active point, for which data has been stored previously (in addActivePointAugmented) in the vectors and matrices *_new.

We proceed by swapping the point to be deleted with the new active point, and then perform the update as in Csato. The advantage of this method is it does not requires (expensive) resizing of matrices.
